Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: An affected girl who presented at 9 months of age and her similarly affected younger brother and father were all found to have a novel missense mutation ( G1758 - - > T ) encoding the amino acid substitution Gly23 - - > Val within NPII .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| NPII associated disorder (or NPII disease, if specific name is unknown) |

The paragraph mentions that the individuals have a "novel missense mutation" in "NPII," but it does not explicitly state the name of the disease associated with this mutation. Therefore, the best option is to label it as "NPII associated disorder" or "NPII disease," depending on whether the specific name of the disease is known.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Disease |
| --- |
| NPII associated disorder (or NPII disease, if specific name is known) |

The paragraph mentions "a novel missense mutation in NPII," but it does not explicitly state that the mutation causes a disease or what the name of the disease is. Therefore, the best option is to label it as "NPII associated disorder" or "NPII disease," depending on whether the specific name of the disease is known. The other mentioned entities, such as "affected girl," "younger brother," and "father," do not refer to diseases.
